comments.author: laci@monda.hu
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.6 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/7.0.500.0 Safari/534.6
Build Identifier: 3.6.13

Mozilla doesn't display broken XML fully.  I can use the view source functionality but it'd be more convenient if displayed the whole XML fully.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Enter a URL that uses the text/xml MIME type and provides broken XML.

Actual Results:  
I can only see the offending part of the XML.

Expected Results:  
I'd like to see the full XML output.
comments.text:

Actual Results:

Expected Results:  
I'd like to see the full XML output.

Works fine for me. Can you please provide an Example URL

comments.author: laci@monda.hu
comments.creator: laci@monda.hu
comments.raw_text:
I've just written a PHP script to provide an example URL: http://monda.hu/broken-xml.php

Mozilla displays:

----8<----

This page contains the following errors:

error on line 1 at column 1: Document is empty

Below is a rendering of the page up to the first error.

----8<----

The actual content of the page which I'd expect Mozilla to fully display:

----8<----

blah
blah
blah
bleh
bleh
bleh

----8<----
comments.text:

Mozilla displays:

----8<----

This page contains the following errors:

error on line 1 at column 1: Document is empty

Below is a rendering of the page up to the first error.

----8<----

The actual content of the page which I'd expect Mozilla to fully display:

----8<----

blah
blah
blah
bleh
bleh
bleh

----8<----

Ah, sorry.  The above was a Chrome error message (which behaves basically the same way as Firefox).

The actual message that Firefox displays is:

XML Parsing Error: syntax error
Location: http://monda.hu/broken-xml.php
Line Number 1, Column 1:blah
^
